Traits.Name: Mimicry
Traits.Content: The Fleshgait can perfectly mimic the appearance of a lost hiker, including their posture and movements, making it difficult to distinguish from actual victims. Any creature that interacts with the Fleshgait must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be unable to recognize it as a threat.

Traits.Name: Evasive Nature
Traits.Content: The Fleshgait gains advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that would cause it to be restrained or incapacitated, reflecting its slippery and elusive form.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The Fleshgait makes three attacks with its Claw Attack.

Actions.Name: Claw Attack
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) slashing damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Actions.Name: Terrifying Mimicry (Recharge 5-6)
Actions.Content: The Fleshgait unleashes a haunting illusion of a lost hiker's voice. Each creature within a 20-foot radius must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 55 (10d10) psychic damage and is frightened until the end of its next turn.

Actions.Name: Contorted Lunge
Actions.Content: The Fleshgait distorts its limbs to lunge at a target. Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d12 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or be grappled (escape DC 15).
